Criteria.TestCondition: An alternate version passes all applicable Test Conditions in this test process.

Criteria.TestCondition: The accessible version is up to date with the same information and functionality.

Criteria.TestCondition: The user can pause, stop, or control the volume of audio content that plays automatically.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Hearing', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The user can pause, stop, or hide moving, blinking, or scrolling content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: Without Vision, With Limited Vision, With Limited Manipulation, With Limited Reach and Strength, With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities

Criteria.TestCondition: The user can pause, stop, hide, or control the frequency of automatically updating content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The page provides notification of each automatic update/change in content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: Without Vision, With Limited Vision, With Limited Manipulation, With Limited Reach and Strength, With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities

Criteria.TestCondition: If NO flashing content is found, then this Test Condition is DOES NOT APPLY (Requirements). If flashing content IS found, then this test should be recorded as NOT TESTED.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Photosensitive Epilepsy / Photosensitive Seizure Disorders'

Criteria.TestCondition: All functionality can be accessed and executed using only the keyboard.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation'

Criteria.TestCondition: Individual keystrokes do not require specific timings for activation of functionality.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation'

Criteria.TestCondition: There is no keyboard trap.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision','With Limited Vision','With Limited Manipulation'

Criteria.TestCondition: A visible indication of focus is provided when focus is on the interface component.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'With Limited Vision','With Limited Manipulation','With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: When an interface component receives focus, it does not initiate an unexpected change of context.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The focus order preserves the meaning and operability of the web page.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision','With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation','With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Focus is moved to revealed content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Focus is returned to the logical sequence.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Labels or instructions are provided for form elements.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Each form label is sufficiently descriptive.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation' ,'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The combination of the accessible name, accessible description, and other programmatic associations (e.g., table column and/or row associations) describes each input field and includes all relevant instructions and cues (textual and graphical).
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Changing field values/selections (e.g., entering data in a text field, changing a radio button section) does NOT initiate and unexpected change of context.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The page provides notification of each form-related change in content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision','With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The item in error is identified in text and sufficiently described to the user in text.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision','Without Perception of Color', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Guidance (e.g., suggestion for corrected input) is provided about how to correct errors for form fields.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The web page allows the user to check, reverse, and/or confirm submission.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The purpose of each link or button can be determined from any combination of the link/button text, accessible name, accessible description, and/or programmatically determined link/button context.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The page provides notification of each change in content that is the result of interaction with a link or button.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The accessible name and accessible description for a meaningful image provides an equivalent description of the image.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: There is no accessible name and accessible description for a decorative image.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The background image is not the only means used to convey important information.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Alternative forms of CAPTCHA are provided.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'Without Hearing', 'With Limited Hearing', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The image of text cannot be replaced by text or is customizable.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'Without Perception of Color'

Criteria.TestCondition: The user can turn off, adjust, or extend the time limit.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: A keyboard-accessible method is provided to bypass repetitive content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Each navigational element occurs in the same relative order with regard to other repeated components on each web page where it appears.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The accessible name and description is consistent for components that perform the same function.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Each heading describes the topic or purpose of its content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Each programmatically determinable heading is a visual heading and each visual heading is programmatically determinable.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Programmatic heading levels logically match the visual heading presentation within the heading structure.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: All visually apparent lists are programmatically identified according to their type.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The default human language of each web page can be programmatically determined.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'Without Hearing', 'With Limited Hearing'

Criteria.TestCondition: The human language for any content segment that differs from the default human language of the page can be programmatically determined.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'Without Hearing', 'With Limited Hearing', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: A title element is defined for the web page.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The title element identifies the contents or purpose of the web page.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Each frame has a title attribute that describes its content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The combination of accessible name and description for each <iframe.> describes its content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'Without Perception of Color'

Criteria.TestCondition: Instructions provided for understanding and operating content do not rely solely on sensory characteristics of components, such as shape, size, visual location, orientation, or sound.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'Without Perception of Color', 'Without Hearing', 'With Limited Hearing'

Criteria.TestCondition: The visual presentation of text and images of text have sufficient contrast.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'With Limited Vision', 'Without Perception of Color'

Criteria.TestCondition: Each data table has programmatic markup to identify it as a table.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: All data cells are programmatically associated with relevant headers.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The layout table DOES NOT designate the layout table using ARIA role= 'table' AND DOES NOT include table header structure and relationship elements and/or associated attributes.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: For the meaningful content provided via CSS pseudo-elements ::before and ::after, equivalent information is available in another way.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The reading order of the content (in context) is correct and the meaning of the content (in context) is preserved without CSS positioning.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: A text-based alternative is provided for audio-only content that provides an accurate and complete representation of the audio-only content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Hearing', 'With Limited Hearing','With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The video-only content information is also available through an equivalent text or audio alternative.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities

Criteria.TestCondition: The multimedia provides accurate captions for the audio content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Hearing', 'With Limited Hearing', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The multimedia provides an equivalent soundtrack (combination of narration and audio descriptions) for the video content.
Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: The live multimedia provides accurate captions for the audio content.

Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision', 'With Limited Hearing', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'

Criteria.TestCondition: There is a mechanism to resize, scale, or zoom in on the text to at least 200% of its original size without loss of content or functionality.

Criteria.DisabilityImpact: 'Without Vision', 'With Limited Vision','With Limited Manipulation', 'With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities'
